section.name: Start Eclipse
section.span: Start Eclipse to work on Hippo CMS addon projects.
section.p: General information about starting Eclipse for Hippo projects can be found here. For Hippo CMS addon projects, you need to checkout the Hippo CMS 7 and have it as a subproject. As the Hippo CMS 7 is very large, eclipse has to be configured to allow for large sizes:

Start eclipse with some memory flags to the Eclipse -vmargs startup argument:
Set the heap size to at least 512M by adding something like -Xms512M -Xmx512M
Set the permSpace size to at least 128M by adding something like -XX:MaxPermSize=128M
eclipse -vmargs -Xms512M -Xmx512M -XX:MaxPermSize=128M
In order not to type this every time, you can do one of the following:
configure your file browser to use these flags every time you (double)click on eclipse to start it.
add the flags to your inititialisation file of eclipse.
For a Unix shell, you can define an alias or write a one-liner script.
The eclipse workspace used for Hippo CMS addon projects has to be configured for them.
